Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Gordon Komodo> Q: How do I direct all my mined rewards to a single Verus wallet?
A: 
Step 1 - First get your wallet address you want to mine to:
IN AGAMA GUI
Click "Receive", click "Get New Address" and choose "Transparent Address" from the drop down.
IN VERUS-CLI
You can find an address if you already have previous transactions, or you can create a new one.  To find an address from a previous transaction, use the command line verus listtransactions and copy the address found after "address".
To generate a new wallet address, use the command line verus getnewaddress and a new address will be created.

Step 2 - Next, using your new address, enter the command with verus-cli verus validateaddress. From the output find the long string after "pubkey", copy without the quotation marks.

Step 3 - Last, use this pubkey when starting your daemon by adding the following line to the end of your command, just before the "&" sign: -pubkey=THELONGSTRINGCOPIED

Your rewards will now be mined to that address.  It would be a good idea to keep notes and associate the wallet address with the pubkey...also to double check that you did validate the correct pubkey for the wallet address, making sure you made no errors.(edited)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Just a heads up hours before I actually post an announcement, we are planning to release an update today that includes major improvements and additional features in Agama:
1. Includes support for the Electrum changes that recently broke SPV (lite mode) for other coins in our version of Agama. 
2. Includes the new Agama core feature of "Hide sensitive data", which obscures amounts and addresses on screen to allow screen shots without exposing sensitive data.
3. We've also added a new capability in our version of Agama only to easily send and receive encrypted memos along with Verus z-transactions, even for a zero amount and just the fee. This allows zero knowledge privacy and strong encryption in sending messages, which we think is pretty cool and useful both now and for applications in the future.
I'm going to announce it as a critical update for both the GUI and command line, which everyone will want to be on by the halving. More details and downloads soon üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> the code is in a public repo, but i didn't think it was ready to use for anything but testing.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> i would hope that we don't end up with people mining a lot of empty blocks. we gave a bounty for it to be finished, so it could be used fully functional.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @superslack the answer, as I understand it, is that the GPU mining is not ready to be used yet, and if someone is using it now, I thought it would only be for testing. the fastest GPUs are not beating CPUs, and I believed we were going to get it finished before announcing it for anyone to use. I don't know if @Alright is using it or testing with @Decker who is writing it. I also hadn't heard it was ready to use and am focused right now on getting the release I described out. I'm waiting for a response from Decker and Alright. If it's not mining transactions yet and people are using it, I hope people stop using it before it's ready or we get transaction processing in, not just testing.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> looking forward to hear more about `We've also added a new capability in our version of Agama only to easily send and receive encrypted memos along with Verus z-transactions, even for a zero amount and just the fee. `, that sounds like it would require that Verus merged in my recent Zcash bugfix to z_sendmany

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> i was going to port it to Verus but maybe you already did: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/pull/3354

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @dukeleto i believe for a couple reasons related to testing, we are considering a delay in the messaging feature. we will still do the release. that zero amount capability was expected, but we are seeing a requirement to send at least the fee amount caused by the bug you describe.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> @miketout it was just merged to Zcash master, I have not yet sent a PR to Komodo yet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> I'm not seeing a bug when we send with zero amount and 0.0001 fee. i may have misunderstood the absurd fee bug

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @Alright @Decker told me that you are helping him test, and it sounds like the data that you guys are getting is quite useful and still very supportive of indefinite CPU mining. He also said that it won't be processing transactions and ready for real use for maybe a month or more. For everyone, if I hear anything about a threatening GPU miner, I will let you know. What I've heard so far on this work, which is supposed to already be perf optimized to some degree, is that when it is ready, it won't beat CPUs, but if you already have a high end card or two, it will be a nice mining option. it also seems to bottleneck pretty hard on systems with multiple cards or risers, as it is very sensitive to data transfer speeds. still work in progress.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @gamer278 We are pretty new, and CMC requires an exchange with some volume and an API that they support. Now that we have this release out, I will check with digitalprice on their API progress for CMC. We are also looking at other exchanges, but right now, we have no real barrier to being listed besides being on a supported exchange and getting their acceptance.
